articles.title: Building Healthy Nutrition Foundations in Early Childhood

content.headline: Establishing Lifelong Healthy Eating Habits
content.intro: The early years of life are critical for establishing eating patterns that can last a lifetime. Proper nutrition during infancy and toddlerhood supports rapid growth and development while laying the foundation for future health and wellbeing.

sections.title: Key Nutritional Priorities 0-2 Years
sections.content: Focus on these essential nutritional elements:
points: Breast milk or formula provides complete nutrition first 6 months
Iron-rich foods prevent anemia and support brain development
Zinc supports immune function and growth
Healthy fats crucial for brain development and energy
Vitamin D for bone health and immune support
Variety of fruits and vegetables for vitamins and fiber

sections.title: Developing Positive Feeding Relationships
sections.content: Create healthy feeding dynamics from the start:
points: Practice responsive feeding - watch for hunger and fullness cues
Offer appropriate textures for developmental stage
Model healthy eating behaviors as a family
Introduce new foods multiple times - acceptance takes repetition
Avoid using food as reward or punishment

sections.title: Transitioning Through Feeding Stages
points: 0-6 months: Exclusive breastfeeding or formula feeding
8-10 months: Mashed foods, soft finger foods
10-12 months: Chopped family foods, self-feeding practice
12-24 months: Diverse family meals, cup drinking practice
24+ months: Independent eating, established meal routines
